thread.title: LawPath raises $1.3m in bid to become household name
thread.title_full: LawPath raises $1.3m in bid to become household name | The Australian

author: The Australian
title: LawPath raises $1.3m in bid to become household name
text:
LawPath, which describes itself as Australia’s premier provider of cloud legal services to SMEs, said it would use the funding to ‘get the name out there’ and become a household brand.
“We want our brand name to be synonymous with what we’re doing, which is helping small to medium sized business access legal services and make it a lot simpler and less costly for them to work with legal documents,” LawPath co-founder and CEO Damien Andreasen told The Australian.
“We’re moving forward towards a Series A as well as a foothold into Singapore and Hong Kong maybe a year and a half or so from now. This round of funding will provide enough runway for that kind of time frame.”
Mr Andreasen said his service, which offers both free customistable legal templates and a network of over 600 lawyers who provide fixed fee Quote: s, has seen revenue up 800 per cent in 12 months and users up 400 per cent.
Brook Adcock of Adcock Group said. “LawPath has grown significantly over the past two years, becoming a key thought leader in the industry. By building a scaleable platform to solve the inherent costs associated with legal services, LawPath is now well placed to become the clear market leader.”
LawPath, which is based in Sydney and has grown to a team of eight, has raised $2.4 million to date. Mr Andreasen said he would announce a major partnership with a global brand in coming weeks.
